post.description:
This endpoint uploads an image file and returns the URI of the uploaded image if successful. 
Supported file types: jpeg, png, gif, bmp, webp (Max size 2 MiB)

400.description: Bad request with details in the problem details format.

body.description: Answer body. The main content of the answer in Markdown format.
body.example: This is a common answer to a common question.

questionId.description: Question ID. The ID of the answered question.

body.description: Answer body. The main content of the answer in HTML format.
body.example: This is a common answer to a common question

score.description: Answer Score. Calculated by subtracting the number of downvotes from the number of upvotes

isAccepted.description: Accepted answer. Returns true if this is the accepted answer for the question.

isDeleted.description: Answer deleted. Returns true if the answer was deleted.

isBookmarked.description: Answer bookmarked. Returns true if the logged-in user bookmarked the answer.

isFollowed.description: Answer followed. Returns true if the logged-in user followed the answer.

creationDate.description: Creation date. The date and time the answer was created.

lockedDate.description: Locked date. The date and time the answer was locked.

lastEditDate.description: Last edit date. The date and time the answer was last edited.

lastActivityDate.description: Last activity date. The date and time the answer last had activity.

deletionDate.description: Deletion date. The date and time the answer was deleted.

commentCount.description: Comment count. The number of comments on the answer.

shareLink.description: Share link. The link to the answer for sharing.

userCanFollow.description: User can follow answer. Returns true if the logged-in user can follow the answer.

canBeFollowed.description: Answer can be followed. Returns true if anyone can follow the answer.

isSubjectMatterExpert.description: Answer is from a subject matter expert.

bodyMarkdown.example: This is a common answer to a common question

editorUserIds.description: Editor User IDs. The identity of users who can edit this article

editorUserGroupIds.description: Editor User Group IDs. The identity of user groups who can edit this article

editorUsers.description: Editor Users. The individual users who can edit this article

editorUserGroups.description: Editor User Groups. The user groups that can edit this article

title.description: Article title. The purpose of the article, stated briefly in one sentence.

body.description: Article body. The main content of the article in Markdown format.
body.example: Python is the primary language for the Data Science Teams at Stack Overflow. This document is a style guide for how Python code is written at Stack Overflow.

tags.description: Tags. Tags associated with the article.

title.description: Title. The actual article, stated briefly in one sentence.

body.description: Article body. The main content of the article in HTML format.
body.example: Python is the primary language for the Data Science Teams at Stack Overflow. This document is a style guide for how Python code is written at Stack Overflow.

tags.description: Tags. Tags associated with the article.

creationDate.description: Creation date. The date and time the article was created.

lastActivityDate.description: Last activity date. The date and time the article or one of its answers last had significant activity. This includes (but is not limited to) an edit, rollback, change to tags, new answer, bounty added, bump.

score.description: Score. Calculated by subtracting the number of downvotes from the number of upvotes

viewCount.description: View count. The number of times users have viewed this article.

shareUrl.description: Share URL. The article's URL for sharing.

isDeleted.description: Is deleted. Returns true if the article was deleted.

isObsolete.description: Is obsolete. Returns true if the article was marked by a moderator as obsolete.

isClosed.description: Is closed. Returns true if the article was closed by a moderator.

bodyMarkdown.description: Body markdown. The main content of the article in Markdown format.
bodyMarkdown.example: I accidentally committed the wrong files to Git, but didn't push the commit to the server yet.

userIsFollowing.description: User is following. Returns true if the logged-in user followed the article.

userHasUpvoted.description: User has upvoted. Returns true if the logged-in user has upvoted the article.

userHasDownvoted.description: User has downvoted. Returns true if the logged-in user has downvoted the article.

userCanEdit.description: User can edit. Returns true if the this article can be edited by the authenticated user.

title.description: Title. The actual article, stated briefly in one sentence.

body.description: Article body. The main content of the article in HTML format.

creationDate.description: Creation date. The date and time the article was created.

lastActivityDate.description: Last activity date. The date and time the article or one of its answers last had significant activity. This includes (but is not limited to) an edit, rollback, change to tags, new answer, bounty added, bump.

isClosed.description: Is closed. Returns true if the article was closed by a moderator.

amount.description: Amount. The number of points the question asker will reward the poster of an accepted answer.

closes.description: Closes. The date and time the bounty expires.

title.description: Title. The title of the question or article.

title.description: Title. A brief title to distinguish the collection and its contents.

description.description: Description. A detailed description of what the collection contains. Supports Markdown.
description.example: Questions and articles about gamification and reputation.

editorUserGroupIds.description: Editor user group IDs. The IDs of user groups whose members can modify this collection.

contentIds.description: Content IDs. The IDs of questions and/or articles that this collection contains, in order.

content.description: Content. The content items (questions and/or articles) contained in this collection.

description.description: Description. A detailed description of what the Collection contains. Supports Markdown.

optionId.description: Flag option ID. Use this id when raising a flag.

dialogTitle.description: Title of the dialog for flag selection.

description.example: A reasonable person would find this content inappropriate for respectful discourse.

requiresComment.description: Indicates if the Comment field must be present when raising the flag.

requiresSite.description: Indicates if the TargetSite field must be present when raising the flag.

requiresQuestionId.description: Indicates if the RelatedQuestionId field must be present when raising the flag.

isRetraction.description: Indicates that the current user has already raised this flag.

subOptions.description: Used to represend a list of sub options. Flag options that have sub options can not be selected when raising a flag.

optionId.description: Flag option ID. This value will be provided when requesting list of available flags.

comment.description: User's comment. Only include this field if the flag option requires it.
comment.example: I'm flagging this post because it is spam

relatedQuestionId.description: ID of a related question. Only include this field if the flag option requires it.

targetSite.description: Name of the network site where question should be migrated. Only include this field if the flag option requires it.

url.description: Url. The URL to the image.

bodyMarkdown.example: I accidentally committed the wrong files to Git, but didn't push the commit to the server yet.

userIsFollowing.description: User is following. Returns true if the logged-in user followed the question.

userHasUpvoted.description: User has upvoted. Returns true if the logged-in user has upvoted the question.

userHasDownvoted.description: User has downvoted. Returns true if the logged-in user has downvoted the question.

userHasBookmarked.description: User has bookmarked. Returns true if the logged-in user has bookmarked the question.

title.description: Title. The actual question, stated briefly in one sentence.
title.example: How do I undo the most recent local commits in Git?

body.description: Question body. The main content of the question in HTML format.
body.example: I accidentally committed the wrong files to Git, but didn't push the commit to the server yet.

tags.description: Tags. Tags associated with the question.

creationDate.description: Creation date. The date and time the question was created.

lastActivityDate.description: Last activity date. The date and time the question or one of its answers last had significant activity. This includes (but is not limited to) an edit, rollback, change to tags, new answer, bounty added, bump.

score.description: Score. Calculated by subtracting the number of downvotes from the number of upvotes

isAnswered.description: Is answered. Returns true if the question has at least one upvoted answer.

answerCount.description: Answer count. Number of answers to the question.

viewCount.description: View count. The number of times users have viewed this question.

shareUrl.description: Share URL. The question's URL for sharing.

isDeleted.description: Is deleted. Returns true if the question was deleted.

isObsolete.description: Is obsolete. Returns true if the question was marked by a moderator as obsolete.

isClosed.description: Is closed. Returns true if the question was closed by a moderator.

users.description: Users. The users identified as subject matter experts for the specified tag.

userGroups.description: User groups. The user groups identified as subject matter experts for the specified tag.

postCount.description: PostCount. The number of posts that have this tag.

subjectMatterExpertCount.description: Subject Matter Expert Count. The total number of individual users who are SMEs for this tag.  This includes individual SMEs assigned, plus the members of any SME groups.  If null, SMEs are not enabled

watcherCount.description: WatcherCount. The number of users watching this tag.

creationDate.description: CreationDate. The date and time the tag was created.

hasSynonyms.description: HasSynonyms. Returns true if the tag has synonym(s).

webUrl.description: WebUrl. The web URL of the tag.

postCount.description: PostCount. The number of posts that have this tag.

subjectMatterExpertCount.description: Subject Matter Expert Count. The total number of individual users who are SMEs for this tag.  This includes individual SMEs assigned, plus the members of any SME groups.  If null, SMEs are not enabled

watcherCount.description: WatcherCount. The number of users watching this tag.

creationDate.description: CreationDate. The date and time the tag was created.

hasSynonyms.description: HasSynonyms. Returns true if the tag has synonym(s).

webUrl.description: WebUrl. The web URL of the tag.

users.description: Users. The users watching the specified tag.

communities.description: Communities. Communities the user is a member of.

externalId.description: External ID. The unique external ID for the user that can be set via SCIM or SAML.

department.description: Department. The user's organizational department that can be set via SAML.

jobTitle.description: Job Title. The user's organizational job title that can be set via SAML.

email.description: Email address. Only visible to admins, or for the current user.

id.description: ID. The user's unique identifier on this site.

accountId.description: Account ID. The user's unique account identifier across all Stack Overflow sites.

avatarUrl.description: Avatar URL. The URL to the user's avatar (profile picture).

webUrl.description: URL. The URL to the user's profile.

role.description: Role. The user's role on the site.

description.example: A group of our most knowledgeable users

id.description: ID. The user group's unique identifier.

description.example: A group of our most knowledgable users
